title: Drawing, "Elevation of a Writing Desk [Bureau Plat]", 1675–1700
medium: Red chalk on cream laid paper, lined
markings:
Stamp in brown, lower right corner:  Lugt suppl. 645b; stamp in brown, lower left verso:  Lugt suppl. 457e; stamped on paper affixed to lower right verso:  71 after which is inscribed in pen and black ink: AO

Watermark:  Heawood #710,714.715, or 716
signed: Signed in pen and black ink, lower left:  G O [paraph of Gilles-Marie Oppenord
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Flat writing desk with scrolled legs composed of lions feet.  Women's heads with wings support desk top.  Front panel consisting of central drawer divided from side panels by symetrically placed C-scrolls decorated with acanthus leaves.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Elevation of a Writing Desk [Bureau Plat]", 1675–1700.
1675–1700. Red chalk on cream laid paper, lined. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1921-22-196.
